Producing compiler information for CITE


Producing compiler information for CITE

CITE uses information produced by the loop nest optimizer (which runs at the optimization level -O3 ) and the code generator in the listing, transformed source, and assembly files. With the MIPS Pro Compiler it is possible to produce all the relevant files that CITE needs with one additional compilation option. The option is -LIST:cite or -LIST:cite=on . So for example 

  f77 -o mm.O3 -64 -mips4 -TARG:processor=r10000 -O3 -LIST:cite mm.f
would produce a listing file ( mm.l), a transformed file after LNO (named as mm-after-lno.f), assembly file (mm.s), and a mapping file (mm.loc which gives the line number mapping between original source and transformed source). Since we are targetting the r10000, prefetching information will be there in the listing file.


Suresh Srinivas (ssuresh@mti)
Questions and comments to ssuresh@mti.sgi.com.
May 16th 1996
